TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XmlDictionaryWriter extends System.Xml.XmlWriter
Public MustInherit Class XmlDictionaryWriter Inherits XmlWriter
public ref class XmlDictionaryWriter abstract : System::Xml::XmlWriter

Docs.summary: Represents an abstract class that Windows Communication Foundation (WCF) derives from to do serialization and deserialization.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can derive from this class to do other functions than serialization.
Note that there is a known issue with the normalization of linefeed characters inside of CDATA sections that you may encounter.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Invoked only by its derived classes because this class is abstract.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool CanCanonicalize { get; }
.property instance bool CanCanonicalize
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property CanCanonicalize As Boolean
public: virtual property bool CanCanonicalize { bool get(); };
member this.CanCanonicalize : bool

Docs.summary: This property always returns . Its derived classes can override to return if they support canonicalization.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Returns `true` if and only if this derived class of <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter> can canonicalize the XML content being written to it, according to the Exclusive XML Canonicalization rules as defined in [Exclusive XML Canonicalization Version 1.0](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=96655).

Creates an instance of that writes XML in the Message Transmission Optimization Mechanism (MTOM) format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks MTOM allows users to optimize the transmission of raw binary data within SOAP messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.Task WriteBase64Async (byte[] buffer, int index, int count);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task WriteBase64Async(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 index, int32 count) cil managed
Public Overrides Function WriteBase64Async (buffer As Byte(), index As Integer, count As Integer) As Task
public: override System::Threading::Tasks::Task ^ WriteBase64Async(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int index, int count);
override this.WriteBase64Async : byte[] * int * int -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: Byte array to encode.
The position in the buffer indicating the start of the bytes to write.
The number of bytes to write.
Docs.summary: Asynchronously encodes the specified binary bytes as Base64 and writes out the resulting text.
Docs.returns: The task that represents the asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To use this method, you must set the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async%2A> flag to `true`.

Docs.exception:
An method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished. In this case, is thrown with the message "An asynchronous operation is already in progress."
-or-
An asynchronous method was called without setting the flag to . In this case, is thrown with the message "Set XmlWriterSettings.Async to true if you want to use Async Methods."
Docs.related: Asynchronous Programming with Async and Await (C# and Visual Basic)

Docs.param: The local name of the qualified name.
The namespace URI of the qualified name.
Docs.summary: Writes out the namespace-qualified name. This method looks up the prefix that is in scope for the given namespace.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the namespace maps to the current default namespace, no prefix is generated.
When writing attribute values, this method generates a prefix if the namespace is not found. When writing element content, it throws an exception if the namespace is not found.

For the asynchronous version of this method, see <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter.WriteValueAsync%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is the asynchronous version of <xref:System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter.WriteValue%2A>, with the same functionality. To use this method, you must set the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Async%2A> flag to `true`.

Docs.exception:
An method was called before a previous asynchronous operation finished. In this case, is thrown with the message "An asynchronous operation is already in progress."
-or-
An asynchronous method was called without setting the flag to . In this case, is thrown with the message "Set XmlWriterSettings.Async to true if you want to use Async Methods."
Docs.related: Asynchronous Programming with Async and Await (C# and Visual Basic)

Docs.summary: Writes a standard XML attribute in the current element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A standard XML attribute is one with the prefix "xml" in any casing. Examples are `xml:space` and `xml:lang`.
